title: Samsung Galaxy J3 (2018)
text:
The Samsung Galaxy J3 (2018) (also known as "Galaxy J3 Star", "Galaxy J3 Aura", "Galaxy J3 V (2018)" and "Galaxy Amp Prime 3") is an <a href="Android%20%28operating%20system%29">Android</a> <a href="smartphone">smartphone</a> manufactured by <a href="Samsung%20Electronics">Samsung Electronics</a> and was released on June 8, 2018.
Specifications.
Hardware.
The Galaxy J3 (2018) is powered by an <a href="Exynos">Exynos</a> 7570 <a href="System%20on%20a%20chip">SoC</a> including a quad-core 1.4 GHz <a href="ARM%20Cortex-A53">ARM Cortex-A53</a> <a href="Central%20processing%20unit">CPU</a>, an ARM <a href="Mali%20%28GPU%29">Mali-T720MP2</a> <a href="Graphics%20processing%20unit">GPU</a> with 2 GB <a href="Random%20access%20memory">RAM</a> and 16 GB of internal storage which can be upgraded up to 400 GB via <a href="SD%20cards%23Micro-cards">microSD card</a>.
It has a 5.0-inch Super <a href="AMOLED">AMOLED</a> display with a <a href="HD%20ready">HD ready</a> resolution. The 8 <a href="megapixel">MP</a> rear camera features f/1.9 aperture, <a href="autofocus">autofocus</a>, <a href="Flash%20%28photography%29">LED flash</a>, <a href="High%20dynamic%20range">HDR</a> and <a href="1080p">Full HD</a> video. The front camera has 5 MP with f/2.2 aperture.
Software.
The Galaxy J3 (2018) is shipped with <a href="Android%20%28operating%20system%29">Android</a> <a href="Android%20Oreo">8.0 "Oreo"</a> and Samsung's <a href="Samsung%20Experience">Experience</a> user interface. <a href="Verizon%20Wireless">Verizon</a> branded J3 (2018) and J3 V (2018) can be upgraded to <a href="Android%20Pie">9.0 "Pie"</a> and <a href="One%20UI">One UI</a>.
